channel.title: ZT1 on ZooBerry
channel.description: Recent content in ZT1 on ZooBerry

item.title: Carnotaurus
item.description: Adds the abelisaurid Carnotaurus to your zoo. This large, distinctive theropod, with its great speed and horned face, is sure to thrill guests. Carnotaurus enjoyed a coastal forest habitat during its time near the end of the Cretaceous.

item.title: Extinct
item.description: Prehistoric, ice age, recently-extinct all go here.

item.title: Green Anaconda
item.description: Adds the green anaconda for adoption in your zoo, a large, semi-aquatic snake that is sure to delight your guests. They enjoy a mix of both rainforest and aquatic foliage in their exhibit and they can go in tanks!

item.title: Living
item.description: Animals that still roam the Earth today.

item.title: Titanichthys
item.description: The Titanichthys, an extinct genus of giant placoderm fish, reigned supreme in the oceans during the Late Devonian period, approximately 380–360 million years ago. Known for its massive size and enigmatic features, Titanichthys has intrigued paleontologists and marine enthusiasts alike as one of the largest jawed fish to have ever existed.

item.title: Mawsonia
item.description: Mawsonia, an extinct genus of coelacanth, was a large, lobe-finned fish that lived during the Jurassic and Cretaceous periods, approximately 160 to 66 million years ago. Closely related to modern coelacanths like Latimeria, Mawsonia was notable for its size—some species could grow up to 6 meters (20 feet) long—making it one of the largest known coelacanths.

item.title: Onchopristis
item.description: Onchopristis, a genus of extinct sawfish that lived during the Cretaceous period approximately 145 to 66 million years ago, was a formidable aquatic predator with a distinctive elongated rostrum lined with sharp, serrated teeth.

item.title: Rhizodus
item.description: Rhizodus was a genus of giant lobe-finned fish that ruled freshwater ecosystems during the Carboniferous period, approximately 359 to 299 million years ago. Known for its massive size, sharp teeth, and predatory prowess.

item.title: Animal Bundles
item.description: Packs with multiple animals bundled together.

item.title: Sailords of Land and Water
item.description: The concavenator and irritator were two dinosaurs that lived during the Early Cretaceous period. Concavenator was a theropod dinosaur that lived in what is now Spain, while Irritator was a spinosaurid dinosaur that lived in what is now Brazil. Both dinosaurs were carnivorous and had unique features that set them apart.

item.title: Leedsichthys
item.description: The biggest fish mod! Leedsichthys is a giant fish from the Jurassic period.

item.title: Northern Raccoon
item.description: Adds the common raccoon to your zoo, a highly adaptable and intelligent mammal known for its dexterous paws and nocturnal habits.

item.title: Patagonian Mara
item.description: The Patagonian Mara is a large, rodent-like mammal native to the open grasslands and shrublands of Argentina.

item.title: Perentie
item.description: The perentie is a large monitor lizard native to arid regions of Australia, known for its speed, power, and adaptability.

item.title: Platypus
item.description: The platypus is a unique monotreme native to Australia, famous for its duck-bill, webbed feet, and egg-laying abilities.

item.title: Quokka
item.description: The Quokka is a small marsupial native to Rottnest Island and other parts of Australia, known for its friendly demeanor and frequent photogenic smiles.

item.title: Red River Hog
item.description: The Red River Hog is a striking, colorful member of the pig family, native to the forests and savannas of Central and West Africa.

item.title: Shetland Pony
item.description: The Shetland Pony is a small, hardy breed of pony native to the Shetland Islands, well-suited for cold climates.

item.title: South Island Giant Moa
item.description: The South Island Giant Moa was a massive flightless bird endemic to New Zealand, known for its towering height and ecological significance.

item.title: Southern Rockhopper Penguin
item.description: The Southern Rockhopper Penguin is a small, crested penguin known for its distinctive hopping movements and vibrant yellow crest feathers.

item.title: Stokesosaurus
item.description: Stokesosaurus is a small, agile theropod dinosaur from the Late Jurassic period.

item.title: Giant Camel (Titanotylopus)
item.description: Adds the giant camel Titanotylopus for adoption in your zoo, perfect for extinct or Cenozoic-themed exhibits.

item.title: Blue Marlin
item.description: The Blue Marlin is a fast and powerful fish, symbolizing strength and endurance in the ocean.

item.title: Cape Barren Goose
item.description: The Cape Barren Goose is a large, flightless bird native to southern Australia and Tasmania.

item.title: Capybara
item.description: The Capybara is the world’s largest rodent, known for its semi-aquatic lifestyle and social nature.

item.title: Chiru
item.description: The Chiru, also known as the Tibetan antelope, is a rare and graceful species native to the high plains of Tibet.

item.title: Chital
item.description: The Chital, also known as the spotted deer, is a graceful and agile herbivore found in the forests of India and Sri Lanka.

item.title: Common Wombat
item.description: The Common Wombat is a burrowing marsupial native to the forests and grasslands of southeastern Australia.

item.title: Defassa Waterbucks
item.description: The Defassa Waterbuck is a large, water-loving antelope native to sub-Saharan Africa.

item.title: Emu
item.description: The Emu is the largest bird native to Australia, known for its impressive speed and endurance.

item.title: European Mouflon
item.description: The European Mouflon is a wild sheep native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia.

item.title: Fennec Fox
item.description: The Fennec Fox is a small desert-dwelling fox known for its large ears and playful nature.

item.title: Gelada Baboon
item.description: The Gelada Baboon is a unique primate from the highlands of Ethiopia, known for its heart-shaped chest patch and complex social behaviors.

item.title: Hoatzin
item.description: The Hoatzin is a prehistoric-looking bird with striking plumage, known for its unique digestive system.

item.title: Inca Tern
item.description: The Inca Tern is a striking seabird with a unique red beak and white mustache.

item.title: Kakapo
item.description: The Kakapo is a nocturnal, flightless parrot native to New Zealand, known for its sweet scent and booming calls.

item.title: Koala
item.description: The Koala is a eucalyptus-loving marsupial, native to the forests of Australia.

item.title: Marsh Harrier
item.description: The Marsh Harrier is a bird of prey found in wetlands and marshes across Europe and Asia.

item.title: Nilgai
item.description: The Nilgai, also known as the Blue Bull, is the largest Asian antelope.

item.title: North Sulawesi Babirusa
item.description: The North Sulawesi Babirusa is a fascinating wild pig known for its unique upward-curving tusks.

item.title: Short-Beaked Echidna
item.description: The Short-Beaked Echidna is a spiny monotreme found in Australia and New Guinea.

item.title: Short-Finned Pilot Whale
item.description: The Short-Finned Pilot Whale is a highly social cetacean found in tropical and subtropical oceans worldwide.

item.title: Siberian Musk Deer
item.description: The Siberian Musk Deer is a small, shy deer known for its long fangs and valuable musk.

item.title: South American Coati
item.description: The South American Coati is a highly adaptable and social animal found in forests and grasslands.

item.title: Superb Lyrebird
item.description: The Superb Lyrebird is known for its extraordinary ability to mimic a wide variety of sounds.

item.title: Takahe
item.description: The Takahe is a rare flightless bird native to the South Island of New Zealand.

item.title: Vicuña
item.description: The Vicuña is a graceful Andean ungulate prized for its fine wool.

item.title: Wolverine
item.description: The Wolverine is a fierce and powerful predator found in the forests and tundras of the Northern Hemisphere.

item.title: AGP - Armored Rhino
item.description: A mysterious armored rhino creature has been discovered in the lab, with no sign of Dr. Ricad.

item.title: AGP - Cotton the White Elephant
item.description: A genetically modified white elephant, affectionately named Cotton, was discovered in the abandoned Dr. Ricad’s Lab.

item.title: AGP - Fast Sheep
item.description: A genetically modified sheep discovered in Dr. Ricad’s Lab, providing key evidence in the mystery of Dr. Ricad’s disappearance.

item.title: AGP - Hulk the Wolf
item.description: A powerful genetically modified wolf, named The Hulk, was discovered in the lab trying to escape its cage.

item.title: Beaver
item.description: The beaver is a semi-aquatic rodent known for its broad, flat tail and remarkable ability to cut down trees for building lodges and dams.

item.title: Bowl Fountain
item.description: A beautifully designed fountain created using Wings3D, with rotation fixes by Yellowrose.

item.title: Desert Pack
item.description: A collection of original desert-themed objects by Quivaz, with technical support from Casey.

item.title: Dodo Bird
item.description: The Dodo, an extinct flightless bird from Mauritius, was driven to extinction in the late 1600s due to human activity and introduced predators.

item.title: Dodo Statue
item.description: A Dodo Bird statue your guests will love, adding a unique touch to your zoo.

item.title: Fictional
item.description: Animals that only exist in the depths our imaginations.

item.title: Flower Fountain
item.description: A fountain with a continuous stream of water and surrounded by flower beds, perfect for boosting guest happiness.

item.title: Fossil House and Deepsea Aquarium
item.description: The Fossil House and Deepsea Aquarium are researchable rides found in Dino Digs and Marine Mania filters.

item.title: Jawa
item.description: Jawas are desert scavengers who live in clans, alternating between sandcrawlers and fortified homes for protection. This mod is a preview of the StarWars Expansion Pack (SWEP).

item.title: Moonwalking Giraffe
item.description: A whimsical giraffe that performs an impressive moonwalk, sure to amuse visitors.

item.title: Myth Pack - Objects
item.description: A myth-themed object pack including a myth museum, ponds, rock formations, statues, and more.

item.title: Parma Wallaby
item.description: The Parma Wallaby (Macropus parma) is a herbivorous marsupial found in Eastern New South Wales, Australia, known for its hopping gait and use of a ‘5-legged’ posture when grazing.

item.title: Party Panda
item.description: A lively panda breed that loves music and dancing, bringing joy and energy to the exhibit.

item.title: Reinhorse
item.description: The Reinhorse is a majestic flying horse that captivates visitors with its grace and beauty.

item.title: Scenery
item.description: Objects that are designed to just sit there and look pretty!

item.title: Theme Packs
item.description: Bundles of objects all curated or designed after a specific theme.

item.title: Whooping Crane
item.description: The whooping crane (Grus americana) is a strictly protected bird in North America. Once reduced to only 15 individuals in 1937, conservation efforts have increased their numbers to around 320 worldwide, including captive populations.

item.title: ZTU Black Tiger Showcase
item.description: Part of the ZTU Collection, the Black Tiger Showcase highlights your Black Tiger exhibits.

item.title: ZTU Panda Bear Showcase
item.description: Part of the ZTU Collection, the Panda Bear Showcase enhances your panda exhibits with a realistic touch.

item.title: Abyssinian Ground Hornbill
item.description: Native to sub-Saharan Africa, this large ground-dwelling bird is known for its distinctive red throat pouch (blue in females) and powerful bill.

item.title: Addra Gazelle
item.description: Native to the Sahara Desert, this beautiful antelope once roamed the arid regions of North Africa. With its slender build and striking white and reddish-brown coat, the Addra Gazelle is perfectly adapted to desert life and an ideal addition to your desert or African savannah exhibits.

item.title: Adelie Penguin
item.description: Found along the entire Antarctic coast, Adelie Penguins are one of the most southerly distributed seabirds and are among the most widely spread penguin species. This addition allows you to create a realistic and immersive Antarctic exhibit, giving your guests a unique glimpse into the lives of these fascinating birds in their icy habitat!

item.title: African Civet
item.description: Native to sub-Saharan Africa, this large, nocturnal mammal is known for its striking black and white markings. A solitary and elusive creature, the African Civet spends its nights foraging under the cover of darkness. Add this fascinating species to your African exhibit, offering your guests a glimpse into the secretive world of nocturnal wildlife! Mod originally published on Hawkkeye666’s Google Drive and archived with his permission on ZooBerry.

item.title: African Fish Eagle
item.description: Native to sub-Saharan Africa, this large bird of prey is known for its striking plumage and powerful talons.

item.title: Abaco Barb
item.description: The Abaco Barb was a rare breed of horse that lived on Great Abaco Island in the Bahamas. It was known for its hardiness and small stature, standing between 13 and 14 hands high, with a muscular build.

item.title: Abanda Cave Crocodile
item.description: These dwarf crocodiles, native to the Abanda Caves in Gabon, Africa, have adapted to life in dark caves, feeding on cave-dwelling fish and bats.

item.title: Abbot's Duiker
item.description: Native to the dense forests of Central Africa, this small antelope species is known for its shy nature and unique appearance. This mod brings the Abbot’s Duiker to life with fully animated movements, creating an immersive and realistic experience for your visitors.

item.title: Abdim's Stork
item.description: Native to Africa, this small stork is known for its stunning black and white plumage, red facial markings, and social nature. Often found in large colonies in wetlands and grasslands, the Abdim’s Stork is the perfect addition to your African savannah exhibit.

item.title: Aberdeen Angus
item.description: Add one of the world’s most popular beef cattle breeds to your farm-themed exhibits with the Aberdeen Angus! This Scottish breed, originating from Aberdeenshire and Angus counties, is renowned for its hardiness, adaptability, and premium-quality beef.

item.title: Leatherback Turtle
item.description: Adds the leatherback turtle (Dermochelys coriacea) to your aquariums and marine parks.

item.title: Ussuri Dhole
item.description: Adds the temperate dhole subspecies to your zoo, with a fox-like appearence and unique cooing sounds.

item.title: Eoraptor
item.description: The Eoraptor is a small dinosaur from the Late Triassic period. It is one of the earliest dinosaurs known to science, and it is a basal sauropodomorph.

item.title: Peryton
item.description: Add the Peryton, a mythical creature that is part deer and part bird, to your zoo.

item.title: Hamadryas Baboon
item.description: Adds the striking and unique looking Hamadryas baboon for adoption.

item.title: Saola
item.description: Adds the rare and elusive Saola for adoption in your zoo.

item.title: Buildings
item.description: Functional buildings such as food stands, carts, restaurants, etc.

item.title: UFO Ride
item.description: A gravitron for ZT1!

item.title: Balloon Animal Stand
item.description: A balloon animal stand with custom vendor animations made by Goosifer.

item.title: Atlantean Fountain
item.description: This Atlantean Fountain will fit in seamlessly with Zoo Tycoon’s other Atlantean scenery items!

item.title: Hotdog Stand
item.description: Pictured is a hotdog stand, conqueror of all lands before lands were even lands.

item.title: Wolves and Panthera Hunting Statues
item.description: Water placeable, Exhibit placeable(Animals don’t feel happy or unhappy)

item.title: WLP1 Scenery
item.description: Scenery, UCS File fixed, Water placeable, Exhibit placeable(Animals don’t feel happy or unhappy)

item.title: Foliage
item.description: Make your animals feel more at home with new living flora.

item.title: WLP1 Foliage Pack Part 6
item.description: Imported from Wildlife Park 1.

item.description: Summary of the Wlp1 Foliage Pack Part 5 project

item.description: A pack of trees.

item.description: A pack of trees.

item.title: WLP1 Foliage Pack Part 1
item.description: A pack of trees.

item.title: AOE2 New World Pile Walls
item.description: UCS File fixed, Water placeable, Exhibit placeable(Animals don’t feel happy or unhappy)

item.title: Fences
item.description: Fence in your animals with these decorative and functional fences!

item.title: Emperor Watercourse
item.description: A pack of components that let you build water channels.

item.description: Tile:Heavenly Compound:5x5,Luxury Apartment:3x3, Water placeable, Exhibit placeable(Animals don’t feel happy or unhappy)

item.description: Six statues: 4x Brown Bear, 2x Lion Statues

item.description: Scenery pack with buildings from around the world.

item.description: Rocks, Tile: Both are 1x1, Water placeable, Placeable at the bottom of a tank, Exhibit placeable(Animals don’t feel happy or unhappy)

item.title: Gardens of Time Mini London Clock Tower
item.description: Imported from Gardens of Time.

item.title: Kaprosuchus Statue
item.description: Kaprosuchus is an extinct genus of mahajangasuchid crocodyliform.

item.title: Insect House With Ant and the Hercules Beetle
item.description: Scenery Objects, Tile:4x5, Water placeable, Exhibit placeable(Animals don’t feel happy or unhappy)

item.description: Tile:1x1, Water placeable, Exhibit placeable (Animals don’t feel happy or unhappy)

item.title: Emperor Chinese Magnificent Palace
item.description: A big scenery building imported from Emperor. Water placeable, exhibit placeable. Animals don’t feel happy or unhappy.

item.title: Gingerbread Fence
item.description: Use the gingerbread wall to spice up your holiday zoos and to create fun areas in your zoos.

item.title: Diplodocus Statue
item.description: 2x4, Water placeable, Exhibit placeable (Animals don’t feel happy or unhappy)

item.title: AOE2 Viking Ship
item.description: 3x3, Water placeable, Exhibit placeable(Animals don’t feel happy or unhappy)

item.title: American Alligator in the Water Statue
item.description: Tile: 4x4, Water placeable, Exhibit placeable(Animals don’t feel happy or unhappy).

item.title: Perentie
item.description: Perenties are fairly large lizards in the monitor family.

item.title: Nile Monitor
item.description: The Nile Monitor is a large, fast, and agile lizard from the rainforest outskirts and grasslands of Africa.
